name: European Communities Trade Mark Association
legal: Company limited by guarantee and not having a share capital
goal:
The Association has always concentrated on those issues where the interests of all members coincide and has refrained from taking a position on matters in which there is no common viewpoint.

The extensive work carried out by the Association so far, following the above guidelines, combined with the high degree of professionalism and recognised technical capabilities of its members, has established ECTA at the highest level and has allowed the Association to achieve the status of a recognised expert spokesman on all questions related to the protection and use of trade marks, designs, geographical indications, copyright, domain names and related matters in and throughout the European Union, and for example, in the following areas :

- Harmonization of the national laws of the EU member countries;
- European Union Trade Mark Regulation and Directive;
- Community Design Regulation and Directive;
- Organisation and practice of the EUIPO.

In addition to having close links with the European Commission and the EUIPO, ECTA is recognised by WIPO as a non-Government Organisation (NGO).

ECTA does also take into consideration all questions arising from the new framework affecting trade marks, including the globalization of markets, the explosion of the Internet and the changes in the world economy.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Consumer Affairs, Customs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Enterprise, Information Society, Internal Market, Research and Technology, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives:
The fields in which ECTA is active can be found, amongst others, in its position papers. In this regard, during the year 2016/beginning of 2017 ECTA has submitted the following position papers:

2017

ECTA Position Paper: Proposal for a Portability Regulation
Proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on ensuring the cross-border portability of online content services in the internal market.

ECTA Position Paper: Review of the Satellite and Cable Directive.
Review of Council Directive 93/83/EEC OF 27 September 1993 on the coordination of certain rules concerning copyright and rights related to copyright applicable to satellite broadcasting and cable retransmission.

2016

ECTA’s Comments and Proposals on the Draft European Union Trade Mark Implementing Regulation and Delegated Regulation.

ECTA’s feedback for the 19th EU-China IP Working Group.

Position Paper on Rim Designs and the “Repair Clause”
ECTA position paper “Rim Designs and the Repair Clause” regarding the respective referrals of the German Federal Supreme Court (BGH) and of the Corte di Appello di Milano.

Joint Position paper on IPR helpdesks and other initiatives ("European IPR helpdesk” and other EU-subsidised IPR helpdesks such as the “China IPR SME helpdesk”, the “Asean IPR SME” helpdesk, the “India IPR helpdesk” and the “MERCOSUR IPR SME Helpdesk").

Joint Statement on Guidelines on Counterfeit Goods in Transit: "BUSINESS COMMUNITY CONCERNS WITH PROPOSED GUIDELINES ON COUNTERFEIT GOODS IN TRANSIT TO IMPLEMENT THE EU TRADE MARK REFORM".

Joint Statement together with APRAM, BMM, GRUR, ITMA and UNION-IP: List of Goods and Services- 512 Characters

ECTA Position Paper on Spare Parts.

ECTA Position Paper on opposability of collective marks identifying Geographical Indications.

and many others

ECTA's position papers are available at http://www.ecta.org/position-papers/
